title: Infrastructure Discovery and Assessment
description: Conduct comprehensive discovery of target infrastructure including detailed inventory of AWS resources, on-premises systems, network topology, and dependencies. Document current architecture and identify integration touchpoints.
phase_rationale: Critical to understand what is being acquired and establish baseline for all subsequent integration work

title: Establish Network Connectivity
description: Establish secure network connectivity between target and buyer environments to enable integration activities. Include VPN setup, firewall rules, and basic monitoring.
phase_rationale: Required for business continuity and to enable all other integration activities

title: AWS to Azure Migration Strategy Development
description: Develop comprehensive migration strategy for moving target's AWS workloads to buyer's Azure environment. Include application assessment, migration patterns, timeline, and risk mitigation.
phase_rationale: Requires completion of discovery phase and is not critical for immediate business continuity

title: Data Center Consolidation Planning
description: Plan consolidation of target's Chicago colocation facilities into buyer's data center footprint. Address geographic separation requirements and develop migration timeline.
phase_rationale: Not critical for Day 1 operations but important for cost synergies and risk reduction

title: DR Architecture Redesign
description: Redesign disaster recovery architecture to address geographic concentration risk and align with buyer's DR standards. Implement geographically separated DR capabilities.
phase_rationale: Critical for risk mitigation but can be addressed after immediate connectivity needs

title: Cloud Workload Migration Execution
description: Execute migration of target's AWS workloads to buyer's Azure environment based on developed strategy. Include testing, cutover, and optimization activities.
phase_rationale: Major transformation work that requires completed strategy and can occur after stabilization

title: Infrastructure Team Integration
description: Integrate target infrastructure team into buyer organization, including skills assessment, training, role alignment, and knowledge transfer processes.
phase_rationale: Important for maintaining operational capability during integration but not Day 1 critical

title: Network Discovery and Documentation
description: Comprehensive discovery of National Mutual's network infrastructure including WAN topology, LAN switching, IP addressing schemes, DNS/DHCP architecture, and security configurations. Document current state to enable integration planning.
phase_rationale: Must understand network architecture before any integration activities can proceed safely

title: IP Address Conflict Analysis and Remediation Planning
description: Analyze National Mutual's IP addressing scheme against Atlantic International's networks to identify conflicts. Develop remediation plan for IP renumbering if required, including impact assessment on applications and network devices.
phase_rationale: IP conflicts must be identified immediately to prevent connectivity issues during integration

title: Establish Secure Network Connectivity to Buyer
description: Implement secure network connectivity between National Mutual and Atlantic International networks to enable Day 1 operations. This may include VPN tunnels, dedicated circuits, or cloud-based connectivity depending on discovered architecture.
phase_rationale: Basic connectivity required for email, authentication, and critical business applications from Day 1

title: SIEM Migration from QRadar to Microsoft Sentinel
description: Migrate security monitoring from IBM QRadar to Microsoft Sentinel to align with buyer's security platform. Includes data migration, rule conversion, dashboard recreation, and team training.
phase_rationale: Security monitoring can continue on existing platform initially, migration provides standardization and cost synergies

title: MFA Migration from RSA SecurID to Microsoft Authenticator
description: Migrate multi-factor authentication from RSA SecurID to Microsoft Authenticator to align with buyer's identity platform. Includes user enrollment, application integration updates, and policy migration.
phase_rationale: Existing MFA can continue short-term, migration enables identity consolidation and cost savings

title: AWS Region Consolidation Planning
description: Evaluate consolidating National Mutual's AWS us-east-1 workloads to Atlantic International's us-east-2 region or establish cross-region connectivity. Assess data transfer costs, latency impacts, and compliance requirements.
phase_rationale: Regional consolidation provides cost optimization but not critical for initial operations

title: Data Center Consolidation and Geographic Diversification
description: Consolidate National Mutual's Chicago-based data centers into Atlantic International's geographically diverse infrastructure. Migrate workloads to Phoenix, Atlanta, or New York facilities to improve resilience.
phase_rationale: Major infrastructure consolidation that improves resilience but requires extensive planning and testing

title: Security Access Provisioning and Identity Integration
description: Establish secure connectivity between buyer and target environments, provision buyer security team access to target systems, integrate Azure AD directories for unified identity management
phase_rationale: Required for business continuity and buyer security oversight from day one

title: CrowdStrike Falcon Tenant Integration
description: Integrate target's CrowdStrike Falcon deployment with buyer's tenant for unified endpoint visibility and management across combined organization
phase_rationale: Critical for immediate endpoint security visibility and threat detection across combined environment

title: RSA SecurID to Microsoft Authenticator Migration
description: Replace RSA SecurID MFA platform with Microsoft Authenticator to align with buyer standards and eliminate EOL risk. Include user training and phased rollout.
phase_rationale: Addresses technical debt and aligns with buyer MFA standard, but not critical for day-one operations

title: SIEM Migration from Splunk to Microsoft Sentinel
description: Migrate security operations from Splunk Enterprise Security to Microsoft Sentinel, including data source configuration, custom rule migration, and SOC team training
phase_rationale: Enables security operations consolidation and cost synergies, but requires parallel operation during transition

title: AWS Cloud Security Assessment and Remediation
description: Comprehensive security assessment of 41 AWS accounts, implement centralized security controls, remediate misconfigurations, and establish cloud security governance
phase_rationale: Critical for understanding cloud security posture and reducing risk, but can operate in parallel with other integration work

title: Email Security Platform Consolidation
description: Consolidate dual email security vendors (Proofpoint and Mimecast) to single platform aligned with buyer standards, migrate policies and configurations
phase_rationale: Optimization opportunity that can be addressed after core integration is stable

title: Integration Program Management Office Establishment
description: Establish dedicated PMO to coordinate cross-domain dependencies, manage critical path, and ensure proper sequencing of identity, network, infrastructure, and security migrations
phase_rationale: Critical path management and dependency coordination must begin immediately to avoid timeline delays

title: Platform Migration Strategy and Sequencing
description: Develop comprehensive migration strategy addressing AWS->Azure, RSA->Microsoft MFA, Splunk->Sentinel, and QRadar->Sentinel with proper sequencing to maintain security and operational continuity
phase_rationale: Strategy must be defined before any major migrations begin to ensure proper sequencing and risk mitigation
